text: my name is Chris Williams and I'm the
operations manager at Q tech Queensland
tertiary admission Center and we take
all the university applications for
Queensland we have around a hundred
thousand students that would come to our
platform and we offer 75,000 of those a
place at an institution the biggest
traffic I've seen on the front end was
about 80,000 hits in a minute our first
service would have been their website so
there was a project to refresh that with
a new technology staff and it was
identified that it wouldn't have been
cost-effective to build that out
in-house so we leveraged from off a
double u.s. in order to build that out
once we did that and that all went
really well we've still great results
and we've identified that our next cab
off the rank was our application
services which is the application that
students used to apply to universities
so we said about moving that one over
and then took on all the corporate
services payroll and Active Directory
and those core services that you need to
run a business and once we got all that
done we looked at our main admission
system and so we're a platform that onto
Amazon as well I guess they've seen a
more reliable services and being
deployed across the three availability
zones in that Amazon has in Sydney we
were able to almost have 100% uptime and
there's no pieces of hardware to worry
about or you know data centers to visit
if anything goes wrong and we're only an
organization of 60 to 70 people and it
allows us to do a lot with a small IT
team and you know I couldn't even
imagine trying to build out all the
staff I'd need to run what I'm running
now in Amazon on premise that just
wouldn't be possible I don't think @q
tech as soon as we went cloud first
there was no looking back
[Music]
